001package game;
002
003/**
004 * This class is part of the "World of Zuul" application. 
005 * "World of Zuul" is a very simple, text based adventure game.  
006 * 
007 * This class holds an enumeration table of all command words known to the game.
008 * It is used to recognise commands as they are typed in.
009 *
010 * @author  Michael Kolling and David J. Barnes + D.Bureau
011 * @version 2008.03.30 + 2019.09.25
012 */
013public class CommandWords
014{
015    // a constant array that will hold all valid command words
016    private final String[] aValidCommands = {
017        "go", "quit", "help", "look", "eat","back","take","drop","test", "items","plant","use"
018    };
019
020    /**
021     * Constructor - initialise the command words.
022     */
023    public CommandWords()
024    {
025        
026    } // CommandWords()
027
028    /**
029     * Check whether a given String is a valid command word. 
030     * @param pString The string to check
031     * @return true if a given string is a valid command,
032     * false if it isn't.
033     */
034    public boolean isCommand( final String pString ){
035        for ( int vI=0; vI<this.aValidCommands.length; vI++ ) {
036            if ( this.aValidCommands[vI].equals( pString ) )
037                return true;
038        } // for
039        // if we get here, the string was not found in the commands :
040        return false;
041    } // isCommand()
042
043    /**
044     * Show all of valid commands
045     * @return A string of all valid commands.
046     */
047    public String getCommandList() 
048    {
049        StringBuilder vCommands = new StringBuilder();
050        for ( int vI=0; vI<this.aValidCommands.length; vI++ ) {
051            vCommands.append( this.aValidCommands[vI] + "  " );
052
053        }
054        //System.out.println(vCommands.toString());
055        return vCommands.toString();
056    }
057} // CommandWords
